title: What are the most common Hindu bhajans? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are a lot of beautiful, melodious, devotional songs or bhajans, a few may be recalled--- 1. Payoji maine Ram ratan dhan payo....Pandit D.V.Paluskar, 2. Chalo man Ganga Jamuna teer................do.........................., 3. Thumak chalat Ramchandra bajat paijania......do................, 4. Raghupati raghav raja ram................................do................., 5. Shri Giridhar aage naachoongi............Pt. Vinayak Rao Patwardhan, 6. Mayya mori main nahin makhan khayo.......Lata Mangeshkar/ Anup Jalota, 7. Nis din barsat nain hamare...........Lata, 8. Jago Mohan pyare jago........do...., 9. Banwari re jeene ka sahara tera naam re.....do...., 10. Satyam shivam sundaram.......do..., 11. Tere phoolon se bhi pyar, tere kaanton se bhi pyar......do...., 12. Alla tero naam........do...,  13. Ai maalik tere bande hum.......do..., 14. Prabhu tero naam jo dhyaye phal paye......do..., 15. Man Mohna bade jhoothe......do..., 16. Na main dhan chahoon.......Geeta dutt, Sudha Malhotra, 17. Jogi mat ja..... Pandit Omkar Nath Thakur/Juthika Roy, 18. Ghoonghat ke pat khol re......Geeta Roy, 19. Darshan do Ghanshyam nath mori.....Hemant Kumar, Manna De, Sudha Malhotra, 20. Man tarpat hari darshan ko aaj.....Md. Rafi, 21. Aana hai to aa rah men kuchh pher nahin hai.......do...., 22. Badi der bhayi kab loge khabar mohe RAM......do....., 23. Vrindawan ka Krishna Kanhaiya.......do..., 24. Tora man darpan kahlaye.....Asha Bhonsle, 25. Kaun chhooyega uski parchhain re jisko bachane wala sain.....Lata, 26. Tu pyar ka sagar hai.....Manna De, 27. Jo tum todo piya.....Lata, 28. Jyoti kalash chhalke......do..., 29. Tora manwa kyon ghabraye re....Geeta Dutt, 30. Kanha aan padi tere dwaar......Lata, 31. Sukh ke sab sathi.....Md. Rafi, 32. Jai Raghunandan jai Ghanshyam......do..., 33. Mangal bhawan amangal haari....Jaspal Singh, 34. Data ek Ram.....Hari Om Sharan, 35. Tera Ram hi karenge beda paar....do..., 36. Maili chadar odh ke kaise.......do...., 37. Jagdambike jai jai jag janani maa....do.., 38. Ye garva bhara mastak mera.......do..., 39. Kaisi lagi lagan......Anup Jalota, 40. Prabhuji tum chandan hum paani......do.., 41. Nirbhay nirgun gun re gaaoonga.....Kumar Gandharva, Vidushi Vasundhara Komkali, 42. Ud jayega hans akela....do..., 43. Om name bhagwate Vasudevay....Pandit Jasraj, 44. Govind Damodar Madhaveti.....do..., 45. Jai Jagdishwari....Pandit Bheemsen Joshi, 46. Bhay bhanjana vandana sun hamari...Manna De, 47. Jay Ganesh jay Ganesh Deva....by so many artists, 48. Hanuman chalisa.......do..., 49. Om jay Jagdish hare......do..., 50. Shivji byahne chale palki saja ke.....Hemant Kumar....., 51. Humko man ki shakti dena....Vani Jayram, 52. Itni shakti hamen dena data man ka vishwas kam.....Sushma Shreshtha, Pushpa Pagdhare, 53. Jara samne to ao chhaliye.....Md. Rafi, 54. Shri Ram Chandra kripalu bhajman.....so many artists, 55. Jaise suraj ki garmi se tapte huye tan to mil jaye.....Sharma Brothers, 56. Shrimann Narayan Narayan Hari Hari.....several artists, 57. Govind bolo Hari Gopal bolo........several artists.....etc.

upvoters.user_href: /profile/横田-チャタジー-スワルナーリ-Swarnali-Chatterjee-Yokota

response.answer_text: The most common Hindu bhajan in North India is "Om Jai Jagdish Hare." The names of Gods are religiously chanted, often including Vishnu and his incarnations, Shiva and the Goddess (Parvati, Shakti, Vaishnodevi). A very common scale in Hindu music is 1 2 3 4 5 6 7, which can be harmonized into a chord progression. Listen to this Shiv Bhajan and Indulge in the bhakti of Lord Shiva
